[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/module.rs] [Function: ModuleBundle::into_bytes()] [Iterator Safety] Can the iterator chain in into_bytes() create temporary allocations that aren't properly cleaned up, causing memory leaks during batch module processing? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/module.rs] [Function: ModuleBundle::iter()] [Iterator Invalidation] If ModuleBundle is mutated during iteration via iter(), can this cause iterator invalidation leading to undefined behavior or security vulnerabilities? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/module.rs] [Function: ModuleBundle::fmt()] [Log Injection] Can malicious bytecode with control characters in hex encoding inject malicious content into debug logs, facilitating log poisoning attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/module.rs] [Function: Module::fmt()] [DoS via Logging] If a module contains gigabytes of bytecode, can calling fmt() for debug logging cause performance degradation or memory exhaustion during hex encoding? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/module.rs] [Trait: IntoIterator] [Iterator Exhaustion] Can the IntoIterator implementation for ModuleBundle be exploited to cause unexpected behavior when partially consumed iterators are dropped? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/module.rs] [Struct: Module] [VM Integration] When Module bytecode is passed to the Move VM, is there validation that the bytecode version is compatible, or can version mismatch cause VM crashes? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/module.rs] [Struct: Module] [Bytecode Verification] Does the Move VM properly verify Module bytecode before execution, or can this struct bypass verification by being constructed directly? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/module.rs] [Struct: ModuleBundle] [Dependency Resolution] Can an attacker order modules in a ModuleBundle to exploit dependency resolution bugs in the Move VM, causing incorrect module loading? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/module.rs] [Struct: ModuleBundle] [Circular Dependencies] Does ModuleBundle validation check for circular dependencies between modules that could cause infinite loops during module loading? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/module.rs] [Struct: Module] [Gas Calculation] Is gas properly charged proportional to module bytecode size, or can attackers submit large modules at underpriced gas costs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/module.rs] [Struct: ModuleBundle] [Bundle Gas] Does gas metering account for the number of modules in a bundle and their combined size, or can bundle gas costs be gamed? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/module.rs] [Struct: Module] [Thread Safety] Is Module thread-safe when shared across multiple threads during parallel transaction execution, or can data races occur in the code field? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/module.rs] [Struct: ModuleBundle] [Concurrent Iteration] If ModuleBundle::iter() is called concurrently with modifications to the underlying codes vector, can race conditions cause memory safety violations? (Critical)
